lead_paragraph: BYRNE--James "Jim" III, 79, of Tenafly, New Jersey passed away on Sunday, May 29, 2016. After a short battle with cancer, he passed peacefully at home surrounded by his family and close friends. He is survived by his wife of over 50 years, Carol, his two children and their spouses, Jamie Byrne and Talisa Reeve, Carrie and Alex Putelo and his cherished grandchildren Luke and Lila. Jim was born and raised in Utica, NY, the son of James Henry Byrne II and Ruth Jones Byrne. He had a mischievous spirit as a child, which carried through his life. A graduate of Syracuse Newhouse School of Communications in 1959 and a veteran of the Armed Services, Jim was a devoted fan of the Orangemen and Army Football. Jim, an author and marketing communications professional, had a rewarding career in media and communications including 19 years as a director of marketing for CBS, the director of communications for the United States Football League (USFL), senior vice president at NW Ayer, Assistant Postmaster General of the United States and director of information at CBS News, where he worked closely with Walter Cronkite. He penned several books over his life, including works on the NFL, the Apollo space missions and "The $1 League: The Rise And Fall Of The USFL". His passions included travel, reading, politics, sports and vodka martinis, but most of all his family and close friends. Beginning in 2000, he traveled extensively with his wife, Carol and then beginning in 2011 with Carol and his grandson Luke to incredible destinations including South Africa, Greece, Istanbul, Spain, Portugal, Morocco, China, Tibet and Peru. Family will receive visitors on Thursday, June 2nd between 7pm - 9pm and Friday, June 3rd between 2pm - 4pm and 7pm - 9pm at Barrett Funeral Home, 148 Dean Drive, Tenafly, NJ. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to the John Theurer Cancer Center at Hackensack University Medical Center. 1/3
